description: Workflow is the Schema for the Workflows API.

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: WorkflowSpec defines the desired state of Workflow.

bootOptions.description: BootOptions are options that control the booting of Hardware.

bootMode.description: BootMode is the type of booting that will be done.

isoURL.description:
ISOURL is the URL of the ISO that will be one-time booted. When this field is set, the controller will create a job.bmc.tinkerbell.org object
for getting the associated hardware into a CDROM booting state.
A HardwareRef that contains a spec.BmcRef must be provided.

toggleAllowNetboot.description:
ToggleAllowNetboot indicates whether the controller should toggle the field in the associated hardware for allowing PXE booting.
This will be enabled before a Workflow is executed and disabled after the Workflow has completed successfully.
A HardwareRef must be provided.

hardwareMap.description: A mapping of template devices to hadware mac addresses.

hardwareRef.description: Name of the Hardware associated with this workflow.

templateRef.description: Name of the Template associated with this workflow.

status.description: WorkflowStatus defines the observed state of a Workflow.

bootOptions.description: BootOptions holds the state of any boot options.

allowNetboot.description: AllowNetboot holds the state of the the controller's interactions with the allowPXE field in a Hardware object.

jobs.description: Jobs holds the state of any job.bmc.tinkerbell.org objects created.

additionalProperties.description: JobStatus holds the state of a specific job.bmc.tinkerbell.org object created.

complete.description: Complete indicates whether the created job.bmc.tinkerbell.org has reported its conditions as complete.

existingJobDeleted.description:
ExistingJobDeleted indicates whether any existing job.bmc.tinkerbell.org was deleted.
The name of each job.bmc.tinkerbell.org object created by the controller is the same, so only one can exist at a time.
Using the same name was chosen so that there is only ever 1 job.bmc.tinkerbell.org per Hardware/Machine.bmc.tinkerbell.org.
This makes clean up easier and we dont just orphan jobs every time.

uid.description:
UID is the UID of the job.bmc.tinkerbell.org object associated with this workflow.
This is used to uniquely identify the job.bmc.tinkerbell.org object, as
all objects for a specific Hardware/Machine.bmc.tinkerbell.org are created with the same name.

conditions.description: Conditions are the latest available observations of an object's current state.

items.description: JobCondition describes current state of a job.

message.description: Message is a human readable message indicating details about last transition.

reason.description: Reason is a (brief) reason for the condition's last transition.

status.description: Status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

time.description: Time when the condition was created.

type.description: Type of job condition, Complete or Failed.

currentAction.description: CurrentAction is the action that is currently in the running state.

globalTimeout.description: GlobalTimeout represents the max execution time.

state.description: State is the current overall state of the Workflow.

tasks.description: Tasks are the tasks to be run by the worker(s).

items.description: Task represents a series of actions to be completed by a worker.

templateRending.description:
TemplateRendering indicates whether the template was rendered successfully.
Possible values are "successful" or "failed" or "unknown".
